55th/56th/57th Street West Elevator- Out Of Service
The 55th/56th/57th Street west elevator is out of service. Passengers can use 51st/53rd street as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.

ME The Van Buren Street Station elevator is out of service.
The Van Buren Street Station elevator is out of service. Customers can use South Water as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
ME #338 - Will Not Operate

Metra Electric #338, scheduled to depart 93rd St/South Chicago at 7:30pm, will not operate due to an earlier equipment train striking a pedestrian. Train #342 will be the next inbound train to accommodate passengers.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
The Van Buren Michigan Avenue Elevator
The Van Buren Street Michigan Avenue  elevator is out of service. Customers can use South Water as alternate boarding stations. Updates will be provided.
https://metrarail.com/maps-schedules/train-lines/ME?Twitter=1&Email=1&SMS=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&gtfsrt=1
ME341 - Will Not Operate

Metra Electric #341, scheduled to arrive 93rd St/South Chicago at 7:09 p.m., will not operate past 63rd Street due to an earlier equipment train striking a pedestrian. Train #345 will accommodate passengers.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert UP-W -  Geneva Platform 2 Rehabilitation

On Monday, October 9, the Geneva outbound platform (Platform 2) will be closed for rehabilitation through the end of 2024. Commuters must use the temporary platform located east of Third Street. All trains will board passengers from the rear cars on this platform. Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - 147th St./Sibley Blvd station closed for reconstruction until late summer 2024

The 147th street/Sibley Blvd station is closed for reconstruction until late summer 2024. During this time, trains will not stop at this station. As alternates, please use the nearby Ivanhoe or Harvey stations. Updates will be provided once the rehabilitation is complete and the station is accessible. Metra apologizes for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience.

Metra Alert ME - Homewood Platform Elevator - Back In Service
The Homewood Platform elevator is back in service.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=0&Twitter=0
Metra Alert ME - Millennium Station elevator out of service until further notice
The Millennium Station elevator is out of service until further notice.  Customers can use the elevator located at 205 N Michigan, which leads to the South Water entrance to Millennium Station
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert UP-W - River Forest Platform 2 Rehabilitation

Beginning Wednesday, May 8, the east half of Platform 2 (island platform) will be closed for rehabilitation. Once completed, the work will move to the west half of Platform 2 to complete the project by the end of November.

Please allow additional time to access the in-service platform and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert MD-N - Forest Glen Platform Rehabilitation

Beginning Monday, July 8, the south half of the platforms, the south stairways, and the inbound shelter will be closed for rehabilitation for 2 months. Commuters must use the north stairways to access the boarding platforms. 

Once completed, the work will move to the north half of the platforms to complete the project by the end of October. Please allow additional time to access the in-service platforms and exercise caution near the work zones.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert - Lollapalooza Alcohol Restrictions

Beginning Thursday, Aug. 1 and running through Sunday, Aug. 4, alcoholic beverages or glass containers will not be allowed on any Metra train during Lollapalooza (All day-Thursday through Sunday).  A bicycle warning date will be in effect Thursday through Sunday, there is an increased likelihood that bicycles cannot be accommodated due to anticipated crowds.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert - Lollapalooza Added Service August 1 through August 4

Starting Thursday, Aug. 1 and running through Sunday, Aug. 4, Metra will provide extra trains with added railcars for expanded capacity and adjust schedules on most lines to accommodate the anticipated demand for ridership, click here.
metrarail.com/riding-metra/service-updates?Source=0&Website=1&OnBoard=0&Email=1&Twitter=1
Metra Alert - Metra and Chicago Transit Authority (CTA) will add service and capacity to existing train routes for Lollapalooza

Starting Thursday, Aug. 1 and running through Sunday, Aug. 4, Metra will provide extra trains with added railcars for expanded capacity and adjust schedules on most lines to accommodate the anticipated demand for ridership. Meanwhile, CTA customers can rely on the Red and Blue Lines, as well as the elevated lines in the Loop to get to the festival. Yellow Line service will be extended until midnight each night, and various bus routes will connect between Metra trains at Chicago Union Station or Ogilvie Transportation Center with Grant Park.
